derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English clyppan (verb), of West Germanic origin. The noun use dates from the late 15th cent
Middle English: from Old Norse klippa, probably imitative

encyclopedia.content: 电信业务 CLIP=Calling line Identification Presentation Supplementary Service 呼叫线路标示显示补充业务 CLIR=Calling line Identification Restriction Supplementary Service 呼叫线路标示限制补充业务 词典解释 clip [klip] n. 夹子， 回形针， 子弹夹 vt. 夹住， 剪短， 修剪 CLIP =Cellular Logic Image Processor 单元逻辑映象处理器 Compiler Language for Information Processing 信息处理用的编译程序语言 Computer

entry.def: A clip is a small device, usually made of metal or plastic, that is specially shaped for holding things together.

example.ex: She took the clip out of her hair.

entry.def: When you clip things together or when things clip together, you fasten them together using a clip or clips.

example.ex: He clipped his safety belt to a fitting on the deck...
example.tran: 他把安全带夹在甲板的一个固定装置上。

example.ex: He clipped his cufflinks neatly in place.
example.tran: 他把袖扣别得整整齐齐。

entry.tran: (电影、广播或电视节目的)剪辑，片段
entry.def: A clip from a film or a radio or television programme is a short piece of it that is broadcast separately.

example.ex: ...an historical film clip of Lenin speaking.
example.tran: 一段列宁在讲话的历史电影片段
电影《原野奇侠》的一段剪辑

entry.tran: (尤指为使某物成形而)修剪，剪
entry.def: If you clip something, you cut small pieces from it, especially in order to shape it.

example.ex: I saw an old man out clipping his hedge...
example.tran: 我看见一位老人在外面修剪树篱。

example.ex: He had already clipped his hair close to the skull.
example.tran: 他已经把头发剪得贴头皮了。

entry.def: If you clip something out of a newspaper or magazine, you cut it out.

example.ex: Kids in his neighborhood clipped his picture from the newspaper and carried it around.
example.tran: 附近的孩子们从报纸上剪下他的照片，到哪儿都带着。

entry.def: If something clips something else, it hits it accidentally at an angle before moving off in a different direction.

example.ex: The lorry clipped the rear of a tanker and then crashed into a second truck.
example.tran: 大货车斜撞上一辆油罐车的尾部，接着又撞上了另一辆货车。

entry.tran: (通常指作为惩罚的)耳光，抽打
entry.def: If you give someone a clip round the ear, you hit their head fairly lightly with the palm of your hand, usually as a punishment.

example.ex: The boy was later given a clip round the ear by his father.
example.tran: 后来男孩被父亲打了一耳光。

entry.def: If you clip a small amount off the time taken to do something, you reduce it by that amount.

example.ex: Boardman finished in 1hr 43mins, clipping 49 seconds from his own course record.
example.tran: 博德曼完成全程用时1小时43分，把自己的赛道纪录缩短了49秒。

entry.def: An ammunition clip is a metal container on an automatic weapon which holds ammunition.
If something moves or happens at a fast clip, it moves or happens quickly.

example.ex: They moved out from the airport at a brisk clip...
Studios are releasing movies at a fast clip.
example.tran: 电影制片公司发行新片的速度很快。

means.word_mean: 1. a metal frame or container holding cartridges; can be inserted into an automatic gun
2. an instance or single occasion for some event;

sentences.sentence: "he could do ten at a clip"

means.word_mean: 3. any of various small fasteners used to hold loose articles together
4. an article of jewelry that can be clipped onto a hat or dress
5. the act of clipping or snipping

sentences.sentence: "he gave me a clip on the ear"

means.word_mean: 1. sever or remove by pinching or snipping;
2. run at a moderately swift pace
4. cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of;
5. terminate or abbreviate before its intended or proper end or its full extent;

sentences.sentence: "Personal freedom is curtailed in many countries"
